node.contents: Also, you have a hard reference to your dialog. What happens if during the AsyncTask the user closes your app? You should use a SoftReference, then see if myDialog.get() is null before trying to dismiss it and start a new activity ---- but I think this shouldn't be an AsyncTask at all - here's a good AsyncTask tutorial w example code that demonstrates these things: http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/07/multithreading-for-performance.html

astNode.text: Also, you have a hard reference to your dialog. What happens if during the AsyncTask the user closes your app? You should use a SoftReference, then see if myDialog.get() is null before trying to dismiss it and start a new activity ---- but I think this shouldn't be an AsyncTask at all - here's a good AsyncTask tutorial w example code that demonstrates these things: http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/07/multithreading-for-performance.html

node.contents: Which error does your logcat give you?

astNode.text: Which error does your logcat give you?

node.contents: Why are you starting your activity in background?

astNode.text: Why are you starting your activity in background?

node.contents: i m using asynctask in order to have a progress bar.is it wrong to start my activity there @alex?

astNode.text: i m using asynctask in order to have a progress bar.is it wrong to start my activity there @alex?

node.contents: may i have to change activity in "onPostExecute" better?

astNode.text: may i have to change activity in "onPostExecute" better?

node.contents: That's not what AsyncTasks are for. Your activity should load almost immediately. If "nea" takes a while to initialize (e.g. code in onCreate) you should put the AsyncTask there and move any network or other intensive tasks to it.

astNode.text: That's not what AsyncTasks are for. Your activity should load almost immediately. If "nea" takes a while to initialize (e.g. code in onCreate) you should put the AsyncTask there and move any network or other intensive tasks to it.

node.contents: thanks for your help.Dp you have any good tutorial in order to understand how to use it correctly?Thanks

astNode.text: thanks for your help.Dp you have any good tutorial in order to understand how to use it correctly?Thanks

node.contents: is there something wrong?Because sometimes the loading bar freezes and then the hole apps freeze too!!Thanks
